# What is CDS 101?

.answer.center[
  "Introduction to the use of computers in scientific discovery through simulations and data analysis. Covers historical development and current trends in the field."
  ]

* Use of computers

* Scientific discovery

* Simulation and data analysis

---

# Mason Core

.answer.center[
  "The Mason Core is a set of required courses that create the foundation of your undergraduate degree. All undergraduates seeking a baccalaureate degree must complete Mason Core requirements."
  ]

CDS 101 + CDS 102 can be used to satisfy the 4 credit Natural Sciences + Lab requirement.

# CDS 101 vs. CDS 102

CDS 101: Main lecture class.

CDS 102: Associated lab class.

* Each section of CDS 102 has its own instructor.
* Register separately.

# CDS 101 course structure

Each week we will cover a separate topic.

List of topics is available at the course website: https://www.cds101.com

Each topic/week will have:

* Video lectures (do before class)
* Readings
* A quiz on the video lectures & readings (due before the first class of the week)
* Class work, either:
  * Individual assignment
  * Group project

In addition:

* Midterm

* Final group project

# Warning

Plagiarism will not be tolerated.

All work must be your own, except...

* In group projects, you may collaborate with other members of your group.

* You may use code snippets from GitHub, Stack Overflow, with proper citation.

Violations will be reported, and will go on your official academic record.
